Week of February 2, 2015 <http://www.pivotal.io/new-approach-to-big-data> A NEW APPROACH TO BIG DATA - LIVE STREAM EVENT Please join Pivotal on February 17th, for an exclusive Executive Strategy and Product Update <http://www.pivotal.io/new-approach-to-big-data> for press, analysts, customers and partners. This live online event will take place from 11:00AM to 12:30PM (PST).
Scott Yara, President and Head of Products and Sunny Madra, Head of Data Products, will unveil Pivotal's groundbreaking new approach and offering that will remove traditional barriers to data-driven innovation. In addition, hear from industry luminaries and customers how these new approaches will accelerate their data and cloud journeys.
Please register today to secure your spot and learn how Pivotal is powering enterprise transformation. REGISTER <http://www.pivotal.io/new-approach-to-big-data> EPISODE #14: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 4TH, "THE NEED FOR SPEED WITH IN-MEMORY DATA GRIDS: ALL ABOUT GEMFIRE" <http://pivotal.io/podcasts> Join us today, Wednesday, February 4th for Episode #14 of our All Things Pivotal Podcast Series, "The need for Speed with In-Memory Data Grids: All About GemFire".
Simon talks about In-Memory Data Grids and why one would choose to use this type of solution in their own architecture. SUBSCRIBE <http://www.pivotal.io/podcasts> WHEN TO SHAVE YAKS, OR AVOID IT ALL TOGETHER <http://blog.pivotal.io/cloud-foundry-pivotal/p-o-v/when-to-shave-yaks> In his first post with Pivotal, Cote explores some of the reasons why some enterprise development groups are thinking they must build their own PaaS versus buy one. These organizations have built a shared, often cloud-like runtime used to support their custom written software used to run their business internally and externally. While many companies were forced to do this in past years, because viable PaaSes didn’t exist; there’s all sorts of examples, perhaps most famously, Google and Netflix, each of whom had to build large scale, cloud-driven platforms to fit their business. In this post, Cote articulates the reasons why this may not be necessary for most organizations today, and why this model could actually cost you competitive advantage.

Here’s our roundup of the top data science news of the month, both from Pivotal and beyond.
